* "Get Him to the Greek" (2010) - This hilarious comedy stars Jonah Hill and Russell Brand as a record company intern and out-of-control rock star, respectively. With plenty of laughs and memorable characters, this movie is sure to please fans of psychological horror.
* "The Lincoln Lawyer" (2011) - Starring Matthew McConaughey as a slick defense attorney, this movie follows his character as he takes on a wealthy client who may be guilty of more than just one crime. With a clever plot and standout performances, this movie is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.

User constraint: The user is looking for a psychological horror movie from 2010, starring Adam LeFevre and directed by Barry Cook or Julia Baird.
Recommendation: If you're looking for a chilling and suspenseful psychological horror movie from 2010, I would recommend "Predators" starring Louis Ozawa Changchien, Oleg Taktarov, and Derek Mears. The film follows a group of elite warriors who are hunted by members of a merciless alien race in an unfamiliar jungle.
Alternatively, you might enjoy "The Red Queen," also from 2010, which stars Alice Braga and Topher Grace. The film follows a young software engineer on a vivid journey to study a newly developed A.I. interface, but things take a dark turn as she delves deeper into the technology. Both of these movies offer a thought-provoking and intense horror experience.

Based on the user's preferences, I recommend checking out "Kick-Ass" and "This Is Spinal Tap". Both movies offer a unique blend of humor and horror elements that are sure to delight. In "Kick-Ass", Corey Johnson leads an impressive cast as Patience Lee, picking up the mantle of Kick-Ass from David Lizewsk in a semi-reboot of the franchise. Meanwhile, "This Is Spinal Tap" chronicles the fictional band Spinal Tap on what proves to be a fateful tour, with a talented cast including Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, and Harry Shearer.

Based on these constraints, I recommend "The Pledge" (2001) and "Gone with the Wind" (1936). Both are classics that have stood the test of time, featuring strong performances from talented actors. "The Pledge" is a gripping mystery-thriller with a talented cast, including Michael O'Keefe, Françoise Yip, and Sam Shepard. "Gone with the Wind" is an epic romance set during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods, starring Vivien Leigh and Clark Gable in iconic roles.
